Package io.github.ai4ci.functions

Interface EmpiricalDistribution

All Superinterfaces:
Distribution, Serializable
@Immutable public interface EmpiricalDistribution extends Distribution, Serializable
Empirical probability distribution constructed from sample data or from x / F(x) pairs.

Main purpose: provide cumulative, density, quantile and sampling functionality for empirically observed variables. The implementation fits a monotonic spline on a transformed scale and exposes convenient accessors for mean, median, density and random sampling.

Downstream uses: consumed by in-host configuration and calibration routines (for example InHostConfiguration and Calibration) and by initialisers that need empirical sampling behaviour.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Field Details

    • KNOTS

      static final int KNOTS
      Number of knots to use when fitting the spline. If the number of data points exceeds this value, the data will be downsampled to this number of points to ensure a smooth fit and to avoid overfitting. If the number of data points is less than or equal to this value, the data will be used as is without downsampling.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      data - the raw samples used to build the empirical distribution

      an immutable empirical distribution fitted to the samples

    • baselineOdds

      default EmpiricalFunction baselineOdds(EmpiricalFunction odds)
      Baseline an odds-like function to produce a probability distribution by scaling so that the product odds * density integrates to one.
      Parameters:
      odds - the odds-like empirical function to baseline against this density
      Returns:
      a probability distribution function derived from the supplied odds

    • getLink

      @Default default LinkFunction getLink()
      The link function applied to the domain when fitting the spline.
      Specified by:
      getLink in interface Distribution
      Returns:
      the link function used for fitting and inversion

    • getLinkLogitQuantile

      @Lazy default SplineInterpolator getLinkLogitQuantile()
      The quantile function is the inverse of the CDF. By fitting the spline on the logit-transformed cumulative probabilities, we can easily derive the quantile function by inverting the spline and applying the inverse link function.
      Returns:
      a spline interpolator representing the quantile function

    • getLogitLinkCDF

      @Derived default SplineInterpolator getLogitLinkCDF()
      The spline is fitted on the transformed scale to ensure monotonicity and to allow for flexible support. The link function transforms the x values to a scale suitable for fitting, while the logit transformation of the cumulative probabilities ensures that the fitted function can capture probabilities in the unit interval without boundary issues.
      Returns:
      a spline interpolator representing logit(F(X)) as a function of link(X)

    • getMaximum

      double getMaximum()
      Maximum support value for the distribution.
      Returns:
      the maximum domain value for which the distribution is defined
